snippet: China has long been implicated in economic espionage efforts, but recent cases suggest that the agriculture sector is becoming a greater target.
abstract: China has long been implicated in economic espionage efforts, but latest cases, in which Chinese citizens were arrested on charges of stealing trade secrets, suggest that agriculture sector is becoming greater target; defendants visited seed testing fields in Iowa and Illinois and brought stolen seeds back to China; American farmers fear stolen seeds give their Chinese counterparts unfair advantage because they can gain access to advanced hybrids without years of their own of costly research.

byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and PATRICK ZUO
byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Kansas City, and Patrick Zuo from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: China has long been implicated in economic espionage efforts, but recent cases suggest that the agriculture sector is becoming a greater target.

headline.main: Designer Seed Thought to Be Latest Target by Chinese
headline.print_headline: Designer Seed Thought to Be Latest Target by Chinese
